the unified budget deficit, projected forward a certain number of years, is an important measure that is already included in the congressional budgeting process.
however, the unified budget deficit does not fully capture the fiscal situation and its effect on the economy, for at least two reasons.
first, the budget deficit by itself does not measure the quantity of resources that the government is taking from the private sector.
second, the annual budget deficit reflects only near-term financing needs and does not capture long-term fiscal imbalances.
